intro: Cryptantha pterocarya var. pectinata, commonly known as the hairy pterocarya, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits called samaras, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forest edges or rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
